N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 673.15 - Investigation of a dam by the department or owner

State Regulations

Whenever in the judgment of the department the protection
of public safety, property or natural resources requires, the department or its
duly appointed agent may, at its discretion and without prior notice, enter
upon lands and waters and make or cause to be made an investigation of any dam. For any dam that: (a) has been
assigned a hazard classification of class B or C pursuant to section
673.5
of this Part; or
(b) impounds waters which pose, in the event
of a failure of such dam, a threat of personal injury, substantial property
damage or substantial natural resource damage as determined by the department, the department may require the owner of such dam to conduct a safety inspection
pursuant to section
673.12
of this Part, an engineering
assessment pursuant to section
673.13
of this Part, and/or to
conduct additional engineering evaluations of a dam, including evaluations to
confirm the dam safety deficiencies that are presented in a safety inspection
report or engineering assessment report, or to confirm any other information
received by the department, in order to assure the protection of public safety, property or natural resources. Notes
